com.xively.auth

Interface XiAuthentication


  • public interface XiAuthentication
    This class encapsulates login services for Xively end user and OpenId authentication. To sign in with Xively end user credentials you can use the requestAuth API and pass the end user's credentials. The OpenID Authentication with the Xively SDK requires the implementing application to declare an intent-filter in the AndroidManifest.xml in order to enable the transfer of the authorization data from the authentication service to the SDK. This intent-filter must have the following data: 
     
     <intent-filter>
          <action android:name="android.intent.action.VIEW"/>
           <category android:name="android.intent.category.DEFAULT"/>
          <category android:name="android.intent.category.BROWSABLE"/>
          <data
              android:scheme="xi123456789"
              android:pathPrefix="/"
          />
      </intent-filter>
    Important! In the above declaration you must substitute the XIVELY_ACCOUNT_ID with your actual account Id assigned to you in the Xively system.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancel()
      Cancel any present and future authentication operation.
      void requestAuth(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String accountId, XiAuthenticationCallback callback)
      Request authentication with Xively login credentials.

    • Method Detail

      • requestAuth

        void requestAuth(java.lang.String email,
                 java.lang.String password,
                 java.lang.String accountId,
                 XiAuthenticationCallback callback)
        Request authentication with Xively login credentials. The results are passed back asynchronously via an XiAuthenticationCallback instance. A successful login flow will provide an initialized XiSession object ready for all available operations.
        Parameters:
        email - End user e-mail address.
        password - End user password.
        accountId - The application builder organization's Xively account Id.
        callback - callback for authentication results.

      • cancel

        void cancel()
        Cancel any present and future authentication operation. After calling cancel every auth operation will eventually make a failure callback and will never return a session instance or other valid result.
